alert.note: Alert for Chester; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 12:28AM EDT until April 08 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Philadelphia, Chester, and Montgomery Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River At Norristown. * WHEN...From this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Flooding occurs in West Norriton. The West Indian Lane bridge begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water begins to cover and close Riverview Boulevard in West Norriton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.9 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.8 feet on 12/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Norristown 13.0 12.8 Thu 11 p 11.3 10.3 13.9 2am 4/08 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 1230 PM EDT.
